definition: to attend school as a day student
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
comma/phrase marked by pause
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: Both borders and day students benefit from the cultural diversity of CA's community.
sentences.chinese: 走讀生和寄宿生都得益於學校社區的文化多樣性。

sentences.english: But for day-boarders, their self-care ability are influenced by many factors.
sentences.chinese: 而走讀幼兒的自理能力則受許多因素的影響。

sentences.english: The ordinary day school can' t give much practical training for living.
sentences.chinese: 一般的走讀學校不可能提供很多實際的生活鍛鍊。

sentences.english: The boy is angry, very angry.
On the other hand, the contribution of day schools cannot be ignored.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，走讀學校的貢獻也不容忽視。

definition: student of a senior high school
to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas/to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together
turn out the lights/lights out
tutorial class/remedial class/preparatory course
school timetable
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
class timetable
to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
daily schedule/daily routine
cram class/cram school/evening classes
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
technical and vocational (education)
to select courses
(of a teacher) to prepare lessons
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
all-round education (contrasted with 應試教育|应试教育[ying4 shi4 jiao4 yu4], exam-oriented education)
